meanings.definition: A person who removes the husks from corn.
meanings.sent1: The cornhuskers worked diligently to remove the husks from the corn.
meanings.sent2: The farmer hired a cornhusker to help with the harvest.
meanings.sent3: The cornhuskers joked about having to peel the corn like they were unwrapping presents.
meanings.sent4: She was a cornhusker, peeling away the layers of the corn with precision.
meanings.sent5: The cornhuskers' hands were stained with the residue of the husks after a long day's work.

meanings.definition: A member of the University of Nebraska football team.
meanings.sent1: The dedicated cornhusker trained hard for the upcoming game.
meanings.sent2: Fans cheered as the cornhuskers scored a touchdown.
meanings.sent3: The cornhuskers celebrated their victory with a team barbecue.
meanings.sent4: He tackled the opponent with the strength of a cornhusker defending his field.
meanings.sent5: The stadium roared with excitement as the cornhuskers took the field.
